name: mushily
content:
mushily adverb
(NOT FIRMLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is too soft and has no firm shape: It was a mushily soft pasta dish made with cheap cheese. The salad drooped mushily in the bowl.
More examplesFewer examplesI found my hat sitting mushily at the side of the pool.

mushily adverb
(EMOTIONALLY)
informal disapproving in a way that is too emotional: She has a weakness for mushily sentimental stories. He was a mushily devoted parent.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was always mushily attentive to his wife.The customers in the cafe smiled mushily at the baby.He was shamelessly and mushily in love with her.

mushily adverb
(UNCLEARLY)
in a way that is not clear: Jenny's mouth was full of food as she mushily replied. He slurred his words mushily.
More examplesFewer examplesHe writes sloppily and mushily because he doesn't take enough care.
